revised_title: Isothermal Autocatalytic Wave Propagation with Arbitrary Powers
tldr: The authors study the propagation of reaction-diffusion waves in isothermal autocatalytic systems with arbitrary powers of autocatalysis. They focus on the case where the diffusion coefficient of reactant A is much less than that of the autocatalyst and discuss the structure of permanent-form travelling waves. They find that for sufficiently large values, the steady wave structure becomes unstable, leading to the development of oscillatory wave structures.
